markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Armor 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Sankeit](/Armor.aspx?ID=34)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Laminar" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=482" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 11 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 5 gp

**AC Bonus** +2

**Dex Cap** +3

**Check Penalty** -1

**Speed Penalty** —
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Strength** 12

**Bulk** 1

**Category** Light

**Group** Wood
</row>

</column>

---

Sankeit is common armor among Varki in the northern Land of the Linnorm Kings, made of small wooden plates or longer slats, typically vertical, joined with sinew or cord and painted with decorations. Varki warriors traditionally wear sankeit with a fearsome wooden helm carved in the shape of a mighty creature.

<title level="2">Armor Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 275 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain class features can grant you additional benefits with certain armors. This is called an armor specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which armor group your armor belongs to, as listed below. Only medium and heavy armors have armor specialization effects.

[Click here for the full rules on Armor Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=211).

<document level="2" id="armor-group-7" />

<title level="2">Specific Magic Armor</title>
[Linnorm's Sankeit](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1849), [Shared-Pain Sankeit](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2386)
name: Sankeit
